subsection.name: 2.4 Compiling from Source
subsection.panel: JSDK1.4 and Ant must be present to compile Cayenne.
subsection.p: Normally users wouldn't need to build Cayenne from source. All required prebuilt JAR's are included with the distribution. For those users who need to recompile Cayenne (for example if they modified the source code to customize or test certain aspects), distribution includes an Ant buildfile ([cayenne_install_dir]/src/build.xml). To rebuild Cayenne (possibly with custom changes) execute the following commands. Windows:

Note that the original cayenne.jar file should be present in the [cayenne_install_dir]/lib directory, since it contains dependencies not included as a source code. The result of the build is two new JAR files: [cayenne_install_dir]/lib/cayenne-cust.jar and [cayenne_install_dir]/lib/cayenne-tests-cust.jar.
